description.plain:
Niall James Horan born in 1993, from Westmeath Mullingar, saw his life change when he auditioned for The X Factor back in 2010. Originally, he had some doubters with his first audition with Katy Perry telling him he needed some time to grow. However, his charm and charisma allowed him to progress.

When it came to bootcamp, Niall failed to stand out in the boys category. Fortunately, guest judge Nicole Scherzinger offered a suggestion to put Niall and four other talented boys that were overlooked, into a group. This marked the formation of One Direction. They came third in the competition but walked away with the hearts of both the UK and Ireland

1D’s first album Up All Night, went straight to number one on the charts and the boys became the first British band to have a debut album reach the top of the charts. Despite the success of the album, both Niall and Louis seemed to act as ‘back up singers’ almost to the other boys and received far less solos in the songs. This didn’t deter Niall though as he also co-wrote many of the songs: “Taken”, “Everything About You” and “Same Mistakes”.

The next few years with One Direction turned out to be one hell of a ride. They released an album every year for 5 years, embarked on tours to promote each album, released fragrances and books, and also a movie, This Is Us. In March 2015 however, the world began to fear that the end of One Direction was near. On the 25th of March, the band’s Facebook released a statement regarding Zayn Malik’s departure from the band. Rumours quickly began to swirl about the boys looking for a new fifth member to fill Zayn’s shoes, but they quickly shot that down.

The boys released their final album, Made in the AM before announcing their hiatus. In January 2016, US Weekly claimed that the band’s hiatus was actually a break up as they all failed to renew their contracts. However, in the months to come, the boys would go down solo paths. Harry got his feet into acting and signed a solo contract with Columbia, Liam also signed a solo contract with Capitol, Louis took the break to focus on his son, and nobody knew what was in the mix for Niall.

In September 2016, it was revealed that Niall had signed a solo contract with Capitol Records. Following this news, Niall released his debut solo single “This Town” which showcases his songwriting ability and also his vocals, as he strips everything down to him and his guitar. In support of the single, Niall also uploaded a one-take acoustic version of the single. The song peaked at 20 on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart on January 14.

On May 4 “Slow Hands”, a homage to Horan’s ‘70s and '80s classic rock influences, was released. An acoustic version of the track was released later.

On September 15, his third single “Too Much To Ask” was released. Later came the “official music” video, released on September 21st.

Niall’s debut solo album “Flicker” was released October 20th, 2017 featuring 10 tracks on the standard edition of the album and 13 tracks on the deluxe edition. The album debuted on the Billboard 200 at #1, selling 152,000 copies in it’s first official week of sales.

The Flicker World Tour began in Dublin on March 12th, 2018 and he toured in Europe, North America, Latin America, Asia and Australia.

description.plain:
Niall Horan returns with “Slow Hands”, the second single from his solo debut album. On “Slow Hands”, Niall drifts away from the more acoustic sound of his debut solo single “This Town.” He shows his edgier and sexier side in this classic rock inspired tune following a man trying to be taken home by a forward female dance partner after a night out on the town.

Horan said in an interview with SiriusXM that this song was made in homage to his influences growing up listening to the classic rock of the ‘70s and '80s. The song was one of the last to be written for his upcoming album because as Niall put it:

I just thought, ‘You know what? I’m missing a bit of grit. Something a bit more funky, something with a bit heavier bass.

The track is produced by Julian Bunetta, a good friend of Niall’s and one of One Direction’s primary co-songwriters and producers.

“Slow Hands” has been certified Gold in the UK and 3x Platinum in the US and in Ireland.

description.plain:
“This Town” is a stripped-down guitar song about still pining after an old flame. While Niall’s lover has moved on, Niall hasn’t and is still in love with them.

The song is the debut solo single from Horan, who had previously released five albums with One Direction. This marks Horan’s first solo venture after signing with Capitol Records in mid-2016.

In an interview with On Air With Ryan Seacrest (transcript), Horan stated that “This Town” was the first song written for his first solo record back in February 2016. At the time, he said that his album was about halfway done and would be released sometime in 2017.

“This Town” has been certified Gold in the UK and 2x Platinum in the US and in Ireland.

description.plain:
“Too Much to Ask” is the third single off Niall Horan’s debut album, Flicker. In this song, Niall laments a breakup and hopes his partner regrets ending their relationship, too.  Speaking to BBC News, he said that this track was very special to him and that he hoped it’d go number #1 one day. Lost love was also a prevalent theme in the lyrics of the album’s title track, “Flicker.”

“Too Much to Ask” has been certified Gold in the UK and in the US. A music video for the song was released on September 21, 2017.

description.plain:
“Flicker” is the title track to Niall Horan’s debut solo album, released on October 20, 2017.  It speaks from the perspective of a lover left without his loved one, as he is left clinging to any bits of hope left to him. This theme is quite common throughout Flicker, existing also in “Too Much to Ask”.

It was performed on Niall Horan’s Flicker Sessions 2017, before being released along with the rest of the Flicker album.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BUaLnDL3f-M

description.plain:
“Nice to Meet Ya” is the first single from Niall’s second studio album, which released on March 13th, 2020.
Niall started teasing the song in August 2019 and presented it at Capitol Congress in Los Angeles, along with the new song “Put A Little Love On Me.”
The song is described as uptempo and with vintage vibes.

The lyrics were released on September 30th, along with a challenge created by Niall: “Trying to find the beat of the song without any clue of its melody.”

description.plain:
Niall Horan first performed “On The Loose” at Channel 93.3’s Summer Kick Off Concert at San Diego’s Mattress Firm Amphitheatre on May 12th, 2017. He played it for the second time at KIIS FM’s Wango Tango at LA’s StubHub Center on May 13th, 2017, only one day after he debuted “On The Loose” in San Diego.

On February 5, 2018, Niall announced that “On The Loose” would be his new single. A music video of the song was released on March 6, 2018.

In an interview to Herald Sun, Niall revealed that Fleetwood Mac was a major inspiration for this song:

You can hear the ‘Mac in that. Everyone’s always trying to write their own “Dreams”. I’m only 24, Fleetwood Mac is the music I’ve listened to since I was four years old. I listen to a lot of other types of music but that’s the stuff that always stuck around with me.

Niall Horan first performed “On The Loose” at Channel 93.3’s Summer Kick Off Concert at San Diego’s Mattress Firm Amphitheatre on May 12th, 2017. He played it for the second time at KIIS FM’s Wango Tango at LA’s StubHub Center on May 13th, 2017, only one day after he debuted “On The Loose” in San Diego.

On February 5, 2018, Niall announced that “On The Loose” would be his new single. A music video of the song was released on March 6, 2018.

In an interview to Herald Sun, Niall revealed that Fleetwood Mac was a major inspiration for this song:

You can hear the ‘Mac in that. Everyone’s always trying to write their own “Dreams”. I’m only 24, Fleetwood Mac is the music I’ve listened to since I was four years old. I listen to a lot of other types of music but that’s the stuff that always stuck around with me.

description.plain:
In “Black and White,” Niall promises a lover that he’ll love them for the rest of his life as he portrays a wedding scenario where both he and his partner wear the common wedding dress and suit colours of black and white. Sonically, Niall highlights his vocal range as he sings over upbeat, bouncy drums and a light guitar.

The lyrics were teased on March 10, 2020, in an episode of Niall’s pre-album release series, Heartbreak Weather Watch.

description.plain:
“Heartbreak Weather” is the title track of the album, which sees Niall talk about feeling lonely and like your situation will never improve, to falling in love and going through the opening stages of a relationship.

The song and album title were revealed in the music video of “Nice to Meet Ya” where it was displayed on a poster on a street wall.

description.plain:
From Niall Horan’s debut album, Flicker, “Mirrors” is a song detailing the struggle an unnamed female protagonist is facing in which she is suffering on her own, and nobody knows what she is going through, due to her hiding behind a mask of happiness.

It was performed on Niall Horan’s Flicker Sessions 2017, before being released along with the rest of the Flicker album. At that point, it was mistaken for “I Need Love”. However, the setlist paper distributed among the fans confirmed that it is in fact “Mirrors”.

description.plain:
Performed as the last song on Niall Horan’s tour, the Flicker Sessions 2017, “On My Own” is a song from Niall’s debut album, talking about how he just doesn’t mind being alone, and in fact prefers it.

Niall, in fact, among the One Direction members, is almost always the bachelor, with very few public girlfriends, while the other four always had constant public relationships. Though he did not have many public romances, he vauled them and his privacy.

description.plain:
From Niall Horan’s debut album, Flicker, You and Me is a slow, mid-tempo song. It speaks from the perspective of a young man with an unusual way of life, who doesn’t know where he is going, but he assures the one he loves that he’ll eventually become the man he wants to be for them. And that’s all because of his faith and belief in their love.

It was performed on Niall Horan’s Flicker Sessions Tour 2017, ahead of being released along with the Flicker album.

description.plain:
“No Judgement” is the third single from Niall Horan’s second studio album, which is set to be released on March 13th, 2020.

In the song’s music video, Niall tells us “There comes a time in the mating cycle of humans, when the need to impress is replaced by a period they call "No Judgement.” Let me tell ya something: it get’s a little bit strange."

Niall first revealed the title of the track in the music video for “Nice To Meet Ya” where it can be seen on a newspaper:

“Small Talk” continues the sexier theme of Heartbreak Weather single “Nice to Meet Ya” as Niall downplays small talk in favour of taking things straight to the bedroom over a groovy instrumental.

The title was revealed in the music video of “Nice to Meet Ya” where it was displayed on the top of a cab alongside a phone number which, when called, played a snippet of the track.

description.plain:
“Dear Patience”, the third song from Heartbreak Weather, is all about, of course, patience.

According to an Instagram post by Niall, he wrote the song during a time period where he believed he needed to be more patient.

https://www.instagram.com/tv/B-SkJSPHKbZ/?igshid=l1mnl0x13iy9

The song is all about taking things slow in a new, budding relationship, even if you’re wanting to jump right in and consume yourself with the person.

This song and “Heartbreak Weather” were the hardest to write on the album, according to Niall.

https://twitter.com/NiallOfficial/status/1238675796631457793

description.plain:
“So Long” is a song by singer-songwriter Niall Horan. It was written for his debut album, Flicker, but didn’t make it to the final cut. However, the song was included in the setlist of Niall’s Flicker World Tour 2018.

The song would eventually be included in the orchestra version of Flicker. A live video of this version was released on February 1st, 2019.

description.plain:
“San Francisco” is Niall Horan’s nostalgic ode to a past love, which is inextricably linked in his memory to the City by the Bay. In lines ranging from Wish I hadn’t been so cruel to Take me back, take me back to San Francisco, the singer implies that his own mistake is the reason for the separation between him and San Francisco, and by extension, his loved one.

In an Instagram Live, Niall has revealed that the song is actually about San Jose but he didn’t make that the title since it seemed a little odd with the tune.

description.plain:
In “New Angel”, Niall is seeking a distraction to his current heartache. The answer? Looking for some one or something to distract him. The termination of his relationship has left him confused and ungrounded, but he’s hoping that doing something or being with somebody can help get those feelings out of his mind…at least for now.

On Twitter, Niall said that “Nothing” from the deluxe album would’ve been right after this song, had he included it in the standard version.

https://twitter.com/NiallOfficial/status/1249830338634842112?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

description.plain:
“Dress” is the first of two Target exclusive songs on the deluxe version of Heartbreak Weather, Niall Horan’s sophomore album.

This song is followed by “Nothing”.

On March 13, Niall answered a question about this song on Twitter, stating that “Dress” was a personal song to him, but that it isn’t exactly a call back to “Black and White”.

description.plain:
Originally from One Direction’s fourth album, Four, Fool’s Gold is a downbeat acoustic track, discussing being used in a relationship by someone you can’t get over, or even want to.

Although One Direction’s 2015 On the Road Again Tour was dedicated to promoting and performing the entirety of the album Four, Fool’s Gold was not performed live by them in that tour. Instead, One Direction member Niall performs Fool’s Gold as part of his solo 2017 Flicker Sessions tour, beginning in August 29th, 2017 in Dublin, Ireland.

description.plain:
“This Town” is a stripped-down guitar song about still pining after an old flame. While Niall’s lover has moved on, Niall hasn’t and is still in love with them.

The song is the debut solo single from Horan, who had previously released five albums with One Direction. This marks Horan’s first solo venture after signing with Capitol Records in mid-2016.

In an interview with On Air With Ryan Seacrest (transcript), Horan stated that “This Town” was the first song written for his first solo record back in February 2016. At the time, he said that his album was about halfway done and would be released sometime in 2017.

description.plain: Following the success of the Flicker Sessions in the year before, singer-songwriter Niall embarked in a world tour to promote his debut album, Flicker. The tour began on March 10, 2018, at Killarney, Ireland, and ended on September 23 at West Palm Beach, US. It had four legs and 81 shows in total.

body.plain: Following the success of the Flicker Sessions in the year before, singer-songwriter Niall embarked in a world tour to promote his debut album, Flicker. The tour began on March 10, 2018, at Killarney, Ireland, and ended on September 23 at West Palm Beach, US. It had four legs and 81 shows in total.

songs.lyrics:
Setlist
1. On The Loose
2. The Tide
3. This Town
4. Paper Houses
5. You and Me
6. Dancing in the Dark (Bruce Springsteen cover)
7. Seeing Blind
8. Too Much to Ask
9. Flicker
10. Fool's Gold (One Direction cover)
11. So Long
12. Since We're Alone
13. Fire Away
14. Crying in the Club (Camila Cabello cover)/ Finally Free (after North American Leg)
15. Mirrors/ On My Own (after Oceanian leg)
Encore
16. Drag Me Down (One Direction cover)
17. Slow Hands
18. On My Own/ Mirrors (after Oceaning Leg)
Special performances
Dancing in the Moonlight (It's Caught Me in Its Spotlight) (Thin Lizzy cover) - March 12, at Dublin
I Won't Back Down (Tom Petty cover) - August 7 and 8, at Los Angeles; August 17, at Chula Vista; August 18, at Las Vegas; and August 31, at Bristow
Life in the Fast Lane (Eagles cover) - During his last 4 performances
New York State of Mind (Billy Joel cover) - September 12, at Wantagh
